action_items.action: Draft formal e-waste/Shredex terms and conditions
Create shared Excel task tracker for AWA/Dicker/Intune work
Take AWA network request to network team (documented process exists)
Provide subcategory list to Mariel for customer spreadsheet update
Get services team to audit Intune deployments via Lighthouse
Address SDM boundary issues in fortnightly meeting (blameless)
Meeting with Richard to discuss out-of-scope work systemic issues
Provide Intune deployment status report
Validate field service scenarios with Amrit
Test field service process with Hamish
Report any continued SDM pressure for out-of-scope work

decisions.title: Field Services
decisions.description: Transition to outsourced model (AWA/Dicker Data) rather than building internal capability

decisions.title: Intune Onboarding
decisions.description: Significant project scope ($50K-$500K per customer depending on size) - defer until pod structure established

decisions.title: Contract Management
decisions.description: Future integration between contract management system and OTC ticket system to automate chargeable/non-chargeable determination

decisions.title: Provisioning Workflow
decisions.description: Dicker Data handles Intune pre-registration, AWA handles on-site deployment, Service Desk coordinates

results.summary_text: This meeting addressed critical vendor coordination and revenue leakage issues around field services and device provisioning. The team agreed to establish Shredex for e-waste with cost-plus pricing, transition to outsourced field services via AWA to improve billing and ticket hygiene, and set clear boundaries with SDMs who pressure engineers to perform out-of-scope work. A customer Intune deployment audit is underway to support Dicker Data vendor negotiations, though major Intune onboarding projects are deferred until the pod structure is established due to their complexity and cost ($50K-$500K per customer).

action_items.action: Naythan: Get access enablement for OTC change management dashboard
Naythan + Marielle: Review NSG cost tagging for pricing negotiation
Naythan: Present change ticket enforcement policy to team
Robie + Jess + Marielle: Reconcile unbilled odd jobs list
Hamish + Naythan + Robie: Establish weekly PPM resource allocation cadence
Naythan: Set up regular cadence with portfolio team for OTC portal replatforming
Naythan: Meet with SDMs tomorrow, then Richard Friday, then establish workflow
Naythan: Understand MV team workload and provide coverage/sorting
Marielle: Present September actuals at next meeting
Marielle + Finance Team: Finalize FY25 forecast with operational model changes
Hamish + Dillon + Stu: Reprice cloud offerings based on pod model decomposition
Hamish: Hold 3CX to Teams migration planning meeting with Dion post-leave
Team: Track GS1 onboarding completion target

decisions.title: Budget Will Go Red During Operating Model Transition
decisions.description:
Context: Parallel running old/new models, NSG revenue migration out, headcount changes
   - **Rationale**: Gavin support secured, necessary to root cause pricing issues vs bundled subsidies
   - **Impact**: Intentional short-term loss for long-term pricing accuracy

decisions.title: Decompose Budget by Product Lines by EOY
decisions.description:
Products: Secure Workspace, Cloud, Hybrid
   - **Rationale**: Attribute costs/revenue to products, enable product-specific margins, guide sellers with confidence
   - **Timeline**: Complete decomposition by end of year for FY26 sales kickoff

decisions.title: No New Hires Until Pipeline Materializes
decisions.description:
Context: Dillon/Peter doing pre-sales (45% billable target), insufficient consultancy/roadmap work won
   - **Status**: 3 new resources considered in budget (Nov+), but on hold
   - **Trigger**: Win more consultancy work to justify adding capacity

decisions.title: Transfer Resource Allocation Ownership to Naythan
decisions.description:
From: Hamish (too busy with escalations) / Richard (covering gap)
   - **To**: Naythan + Robie (weekly cadence)
   - **Rationale**: Cannot live with Hamish, needs operational owner with headspace

decisions.title: Work Instruction Approach for Change Ticket Enforcement
decisions.description:
Context: Technical enforcement not possible in OTC
   - **Method**: Policy communication, training, not system control

decisions.title: Consider Contractor Use Until Pipeline Grows
decisions.description:
Context: Using Ploy and others to fill gaps without committing to full hire
   - **Condition**: Until PS pipeline supports permanent headcount

---

results.summary_text:
Strategic budget review and operational transformation planning session. Leadership acknowledges intentional budget variance during operating model transition from network-heavy bundled services to decomposed cloud product lines. Critical process gaps identified in billable time tracking and resource allocation workflows.

---

action_items.action: Naythan + Hamish + Nigel: Align on hiring strategy and timelines THIS WEEK
Naythan + Dillon + Gina (OTC): Design new change management process
Naythan: Intervene on Mandeep (MV) overwork and bottleneck situation
action_items.deadline: Immediate (potentially Melbourne trip, not yet booked)

action_items.action: Hamish + Naythan + JP + Marielle: Pipeline hygiene grooming session
Hamish: Get Alex to provide SGS training/enablement
Hamish + Naythan + Marielle: Forecast parallel operating structure costs
Hamish: Add Philippines patching team member role to pipeline
Hamish + Naythan: Design Jessica's pre-sales stand-up coordination role
Marielle: Present full budget walkthrough to leadership team next week
Marielle: Coordinate with Sarah on personnel cost changes from "what group"
Hamish + Dillon + Peter + Naythan: Establish new project hire for Secure Workspace Principal
Hamish + Team + Gavin + Leadership: Resolve helpdesk strategy and BU structure
Team + Marielle: Backlog invoicing reconciliation (Robbie + Jess working through)
action_items.deadline: Ongoing (first month closed, retrospective items flowing)

decisions.title: Establish Weekly Leadership Meeting Cadence
decisions.description:
Format: Projects/ops issues, HR (Kristy join), Finance (Marielle join)
   - **Goal**: No more multiple emails, coordinate hiring/costs/project impacts in one room
   - **Participants**: Hamish, Naythan, Dillon, Peter, + 3rd Principal when hired, Marielle, (Kristy)
   - **Purpose**: Level set, resilient teams vs point people, visibility

decisions.title: PNL Decomposition by Products
decisions.description:
Products: Secure Workspace, Cloud, Hybrid
   - **Rationale**: "Talk same language", traceability from balance sheet → service catalogue
   - **Timeline**: In progress, Safina working on it, Hamish handing to Marielle/Sarah
   - **Impact**: Product-aligned financials matching product-aligned principals

decisions.title: Change Management Priority #1 Operational Intervention
decisions.description:
Rationale: Ampac 10-day P1 from self-inflicted vnet mistake, ITIL maturity 2/10, creating overwork → mistakes cycle
   - **Approach**: Understand OTC capabilities, workshop new process, enforce/educate
   - **Quote**: "What if we just stop changing things as quickly and as rapidly?" - Naythan (Day 1 observation)
   - **Expected**: Will reduce MV overload, prevent shooting selves in foot

decisions.title: Move Mandeep (MV) from BAU to Consulting
decisions.description:
Context: MV wants to be consultant but won't let go of BAU → overworked + bottleneck
   - **Forcing Function**: "Forcing function for others to step up" - if MV gone, team must empower
   - **Approach**: Naythan to help transition, empower team for end-to-end ownership without approval gates
   - **Timeline**: Immediate intervention needed (health + quality impacts visible)

decisions.title: Budget Will Go Red with Parallel Structure
decisions.description:
Context: Hiring new roles (principals, engineers, etc.) while old structure still operational
   - **Board**: Q1 approved, full year pending AI/strategic narrative revisions
   - **Status**: Budget "not formally endorsed", "numbers still fluid", "feels like US Congress supply situation"
   - **Communication**: Gavin managing board expectations, team to be level set next week

decisions.title: Earned Value Revenue Recognition for Projects
decisions.description:
Method: Percentage of completion based on project manager OTC inputs
   - **Example**: $100K project 50% complete → recognize $50K revenue
   - **Context**: Peter asking about when revenue counted (answer: not at final payment, but progressive)

decisions.title: Helpdesk as Separate Tower/BU
decisions.description:
Status: "Everyone agreed we need to think about this"
   - **Problem**: Can't tender competitively without helpdesk pre-sales capability
   - **Option**: Create helpdesk services BU with dedicated pre-sales, pricing models, volume metrics
   - **Benefit**: Stop treating as cost, start selling competitively
   - **Challenge**: Cloud team doesn't have expertise (Dillon/Hamish acknowledged)
   - **Timeline**: Discussion next week with Gavin + leadership

---
decisions.decision_maker: Hamish proposal, leadership discussion next week

results.summary_text: First formal leadership team meeting establishing regular cadence with Finance (Marielle) integration. Critical operational issues identified: ITIL maturity rated 2/10 after Ampac 10-day outage from self-inflicted change, Mandeep (MV) overwork crisis requiring intervention, and helpdesk strategy misalignment with tender requirements. Strong August financial performance ($243K vs $76K budget), but hiring plans will push budget into red territory with board approval pending strategic AI/transforma
